displaytitle: Study for Cloelia and her Companions Crossing the Tiber River on Horseback
medium: Pen and black ink and brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings:
Stamp in red, lower right: [Carlo Prayer with a star within a circle] [Lugt 2044]
Stamp in blue, verso, lower right: [circle with initials D.F.P.] [Lugt 750a]
inscribed:
In brown ink, lower center: Lou t pecheuse
In graphite, verso, upper left corner: F 291
In graphite, verso, center left: BRUSCOLI 1929 $13 50 [in Platt hand]
In graphite, verso, lower left: 0-64 Laurent Pechx 1721/40 - 1804 [in Platt hand]
In graphite, verso, lower left: Pecheux Lorenzo dipinto nel R. Plazzo di Torino morto 1821

texts.textentryhtml: Carlo Prayer (1826-1900), stamp (L. 2044); probably Bruscoli from whom acquired by Platt in 1929, inscription on the verso.
texts.remarks: As per Giada Damen, IMLS Drawings 2018-2020

bibliography.boilertext: "Sixteenth-to eighteenth-century French drawings from the permanent collection: a checklist of the exhibition," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 43-49.
bibliography.citation: "Sixteenth-to eighteenth-century French drawings from the permanent collection: a checklist of the exhibition," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 43-49., p. 48

caption: Laurent Pécheux (French, 1729–1821), Study for Cloelia and her Companions Crossing the Tiber River on Horseback, ca. 1787. Pen and black ink and brown wash; 33.3 x 52.6 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-1153)
